Hi all -

forgive me for this OT posting - but I hope that you can shed light on that
topic; and/or send me to a more appropriate community. Thx!
(I asked on softwaretestingexperts@yahoogroups, but this is more sort of a
job listing group).

---------

I am in an company with about 50 developers (+ management) which now
wants/has to set up a system test group = probably 10..15 people who do
system testing (we have 10 "country versions" of our software and up to 3
versions per country in the field, up to 3 versions "in the making").
I do know about 

* testing from a testers perspective (my favorite book: B.Beizer's "Black
Box Testing")

* testing in the developer community (JUnit testing is done, although
haphazardly, by about 50% of the developers; direct application tests are
done by many developers)

but I do NOT know much about "higher level issues" like

* input quality level for system tests done by the system test group (how to
define and ascertain it?)
* management of the system test group
* conflict resolution between development and system test group
* and what else?

Is there any literature out there (books, on the net, ...) that could be
helpful? (yes, I did a google, but up to now the results are "quite mixed").

Also, anyone who has experience to share is very welcome!

Thank you!
Harald M. Mueller
Germany
